The claim was published on Facebook on M: 2019, and has been shared more than 40,000 times.
Expert opinions from Dr: Duangkaew Panyapoo and Dr. Kanitha Tananuwong, both from reputable institutions, dismiss the claim as a hoax and state that Bengal currants do not have any harmful effects if eaten in an appropriate amount.
The claim was also debunked by the Thai: checking group Sure and Share Centre in a video report posted on April 22, 2019.
